Posts.Content: Hi  I'm not sure how to put this in words but I will try.  Please don't delay your treatment. I know as a mum we always put everyone else first but you still have a fighting chance to around for a very long time.  I was diagnosed with primary and secondary at the same time and oh how I wish it was just primary but it's not and I have to to live with this. I have to fight to be around as long as I can for my children . We are stronger than we think and you will be too.  Sending you a hug xxx chemo for me was no where near as bad as I imagined it would be
Posts.Title: Delaying chemo

Posts.Content: That's good news.  I am so pleased you are not going to delay more than a few weeks.  Internet shopping will get you sorted for Xmas. Hope the girls settle into new school and best of luck to you and your family xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Delaying chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Leighton Denny Renovate Repair Cream has helped with my nails, it's a really small tube but it lasts for a while. Best Wishes xxxx
Posts.Title: Nail problem from chemo - urgent advice please?

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies Leighton Denny Renovate Repair Cream has helped with my nails, it's a really small tube but it lasts for a while. Best Wishes xxxx
Posts.Title: Nail problem from chemo - urgent advice please?

Posts.Content: I know exactly what you mean.  I'm still not in the support group for ESA and I am secondary at 45!! Havnt had chance to get it sorted properly as in the middle af radiotherapy and its a three hour round trip everyday.  I know I need to sort it but treatment is priority at the moment.  First time I've been off work sice I was sixteen.  Just get letters off them for another sick note. I'll let you know if I win the lottery. Xx Best wishes xxxx hope you have a nice day xxx
Posts.Title: ESA

Posts.Content: Hi Dayity Have you looked into getting PIP? A McMillan benefits advisor helped me with the form.  It's worth looking into. Take Care xx
Posts.Title: ESA

Posts.Content: Thanks Gill xx I'll get it sorted  Thanks again
Posts.Title: ESA

Posts.Content: Hi Susan Just wanted to say welcome. I quite like the name yellow roses. If feels calming and makes me think of lovely flowers.  It's better than my user name anyway, just my name. Best wishes xxxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Living with Letrozole, as wel as breast cancer

Posts.Content: Brilliant news Hun. Go off and enjoy yourself, your so young and I'm so pleased it's all turned out good xxxxx
Posts.Title: How long did you wait for screening appointment? *incredibly stressed...

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I have popped over from the secondary group.  I was diagnosed primary and secondary at the same time. Age 45.  Her 2 positive. Just interested in info on the photodynamic therapy. ( I have not had an op) .  Is it different from proton?  Can you pay private to have it done in uk? I will ask my onc about it but wondered what you guys know about it. Thank you xx best wishes
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi Hun You need to go back to doctors.  It could be nothing but you need it checked out.  Don't feel like your wasteing their time you won't settle.  If it's worrying you and it is go back.  Xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: 2nd armpit lump

Posts.Content: Hi Rosemarie Good luck with your chemo.  Your correct in everyone is different. I have sat next to a lady in the treatment room the same age as you and she has sailed through it with very little side effects. That might be you hopefully. I put half a stone on with chemo!! So you don't always loose weight . Best wishes angela xxxxx
Posts.Title: Nervous of my first chemo treatment!
